main event: A bright, round, fast-moving object about the size of a star was observed at an altitude of 80-90 degrees above the horizon, moving at an estimated speed of 600 mph in a straight, horizontal path for a distance of 30 degrees.
interesting points: The object had a distinctive shape, was luminous, and moved at a very high speed in a straight path, indicating controlled flight.
The observation was made by a competent observer with experience in observing meteorological phenomena and astronomical objects.
The object was descending in the sky, moving from left to right, and disappeared behind a ridge of hills.
The object was described as a 'fire ball' that was red at the base and white above.
The sighting was observed through a theodolite and lasted for about 1.5 hours.
location: Indian House Lake area of Canada
witnesses: civilian observers at the Indian House Lake Department of Transport radio station
photographs: yes, the report indicates photographs were taken
